Home.title: Meeting Scheduler
intro-array: This is a demonstration project of a meeting scheduler.
The frontend is hosted in GitHub Pages, while the backend is done using Firebase.
motivation-array: I wanted to learn Web Development in order to open new doors for career progress/change.
I wanted to do a project based on and idea without completely following a tutorial.
While, obviously, reading documentation and following some tutorial for some of the features that I was unfamiliar with.
use-array: The main features can be seen in the following videos.
Home.add-update-remove-image: Animation showing how to add, update or remove a client.
Home.see-schedule-image: Animation showing the upcoming two week schedule.
challenges-array: I faced some challenges while building this app, the more relevant ones are described below:
challenges-bullet-array: How to organize the project in such a way that folder structure would make sense.
The importance of writing tests beforehand or at least concurrently with the development of features.
By using the most recent version of react/firebase and on top of it with Typescript, made almost every other tool/documentation either obsolete or simply incorrect for this app.
At a first glance I tried to add a lot of features simultaneously, which is not a good approach.
learning-array: I've learned through this little project:
learning-bullet-array: How to use react hooks without triggering infinite loops.
How to work with a backend as a service such as Firebase.
How to deploy the frontend automatically using GitHub and GitHub actions.
How to use Bootstrap for a consistent look and feel.
How writing tests beforehand or concurrently avoids lack of motivation to write them to code that is 'already working'.
